ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Prerequisites/Preconditions] The client implementation has to have the network address of the server.
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] This network address [the network address of the server] satisfies the requirements of a network address for the underlying transport of remote procedure call (RPC).
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] This [network address] allows the client to initiate communication with the server by using the RPC Protocol.
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] This protocol uses security information as specified in [MS-RPCE].

[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] The client and Exchange NSPI server are required to share one or both of the NT LAN Manager (NTLM) Authentication Protocol or Kerberos security providers (2) in common for the RPC transport.
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] Additionally, the server is required to register the negotiation security provider.
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] The protocol does not require mutual authentication.
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] The client and Exchange NSPI server use an authentication mechanism that is capable of authenticating the client to the server.
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] The protocol does not require that the client be capable of authenticating the server.
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] The credentials of the client have to be recognized by the server.
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] These credentials [the credentials of the client] are obtained from the shared security provider (2).
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] The mechanism for obtaining these credentials [the credentials of the client] is specific to the protocol of the security provider that is used.
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] The server has to have determined any local policies as described in sections 2, 3, and 5.
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] This [determine any local policies] allows the server to provide consistent behavior for all communications in the protocol.
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] The server has to be configured to support the required code pages and language code identifiers (LCIDs), as described in sections 2.2.4 and 2.2.5.

[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] This [The server is configured to support the required code pages and language code identifiers (LCIDs)] allows the server to provide the minimal required string conversions and sort orders.
[In Prerequisites/Preconditions] The server has to be started and fully initialized before the protocol can start.
[In Standards Assignments] The value of Interface UUID is F5CC5A18-4264-101A-8C59-08002B2F8426, and its reference is [C706] section A.2.5.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R8.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Messages] The following sections specify transport methods of Exchange Server NSPI Protocol messages and common Exchange Server NSPI Protocol data types.
[In Messages] Unless otherwise specified, all numeric values in this specification are in little-endian format.
[In Messages] Unless otherwise specified, all Unicode string representations are in UTF-16LE format.
[In Transport] All remote procedure call (RPC) protocols use RPC dynamic endpoints (2) and well-known endpoints (2), as specified in [C706].
[In Transport] The Exchange Server NSPI Protocol uses the following RPC protocol sequences: RPC over HTTPS.
[In Transport] The Exchange Server NSPI Protocol uses the following RPC protocol sequences: RPC over TCP.<1>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1877.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Transport] The protocol allows a server to be configured to use a specific port for RPC over TCP.
[In Transport] The mechanism for configuring a server to use a specific port is not constrained by the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.
[In Transport] The mechanism for a client to discover this configured TCP port is not constrained by the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.
[In Transport] For the network protocol sequence RPC over HTTPS, this protocol MUST use the well-known endpoint 6004.
[In Transport] For RPC over TCP, this protocol can use RPC dynamic endpoints, as defined in Part 4 of [C706].
[In Transport] This protocol MUST use the UUID F5CC5A18-4264-101A-8C59-08002B2F8426.
[In Transport] The protocol MUST use the RPC version number 56.0.
[In Transport] The protocol uses the underlying RPC protocol to retrieve the identity of the client that made the method call, as specified in [MS-RPCE].
[In Transport] The server MAY use this identity [the identity of the client that made the method call] to perform access checks, as described in section 5 of this document.
[In Transport] The server MAY enforce limits on the maximum RPC packet size that it [server] will accept.
[In Common Data Types] This protocol enables the ms_union extension, as specified in [MS-RPCE].

[In Common Data Types] This protocol requests that the RPC runtime, via the strict_context_handle attribute, rejects the use of context handles created by a method of a different RPC interface than this one, as specified in [MS-RPCE].
[In Common Data Types] In addition to the RPC base types and definitions specified in [C706] and [MS-RPCE], the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol uses additional data types.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXNSPI_R1562, MS-OXNSPI_R1563, MS-OXNSPI_R1564, MS-OXNSPI_R1565, MS-OXNSPI_R1567, MS-OXNSPI_R1568, MS-OXNSPI_R1570, MS-OXNSPI_R1572, MS-OXNSPI_R1573, MS-OXNSPI_R1574, MS-OXNSPI_R1575, MS-OXNSPI_R1587, MS-OXNSPI_R1591, MS-OXNSPI_R1592.

[In Common Data Types] FlatUID_r data type: Byte order specified GUIDs.
[In Common Data Types] PropertyTagArray_r: Property value structure.
[In Common Data Types] Binary_r: Property value structure.
[In Common Data Types] ShortArray_r: Property value structure.
[In Common Data Types] LongArray_r: Property value structure.
[In Common Data Types] StringArray_r: Property value structure.
[In Common Data Types] BinaryArray_r: Property value structure.
[In Common Data Types] FlatUIDArray_r: Property value structure.
[In Common Data Types] WStringArray_r: Property value structure.
[In Common Data Types] DateTimeArray_r: Property value structure.
[In Common Data Types] PROP_VAL_UNION: Property value structure.

[In Common Data Types] PropertyRow_r: Table row structure.

[In Common Data Types] NSPI_HANDLE: RPC context handle.
[In Constant Value Definitions] This section defines common values that are used in multiple messages.

[In Permitted Property Type Values] The property type values [PtypInteger32, PtypBoolean, PtypString8, PtypBinary, PtypString, PtypTime, PtypErrorCode, PtypMultipleString8, PtypMultipleBinary and PtypMultipleString] specified in this section are used to specify property types.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Permitted Property Type Values] They [PtypInteger32, PtypBoolean, PtypString8, PtypBinary, PtypString, PtypTime, PtypErrorCode, PtypMultipleString8, PtypMultipleBinary and PtypMultipleString] appear in various places in the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.

[In Permitted Property Type Values] All Exchange NSPI servers and clients MUST recognize and be capable of accepting and returning these property types [PtypInteger32, PtypBoolean, PtypString8, PtypBinary, PtypString, PtypTime, PtypErrorCode, PtypMultipleString8, PtypMultipleBinary and PtypMultipleString].

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Permitted Property Type Values] The Exchange NSPI server under test MUST be capable of returning these property types [PtypInteger32, PtypBoolean, PtypString8, PtypBinary, PtypString, PtypTime, PtypErrorCode, PtypMultipleString8, PtypMultipleBinary and PtypMultipleString].

[In Permitted Property Type Values] Values [PtypInteger32, PtypBoolean, PtypString8, PtypBinary, PtypString, PtypTime, PtypErrorCode, PtypMultipleString8, PtypMultipleBinary and PtypMultipleString] that represent property types are defined in [MS-OXCDATA].
[In Permitted Property Type Values] The values specified in [MS-OXCDATA] are 16-bit integers.
[In Permitted Property Type Values] The Exchange Server NSPI Protocol uses the same numeric values [The values specified in [MS-OXCDATA] are 16-bit integers] but expressed as 32-bit integers.
[In Permitted Property Type Values] The high-order 16 bits of the 32-bit representation that is used by the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol are always 0x0000.

[In Permitted Property Type Values] The following table lists the permitted values [PtypInteger32, PtypBoolean, PtypString8, PtypBinary, PtypString, PtypTime, PtypErrorCode, PtypMultipleString8, PtypMultipleBinary and PtypMultipleString] for the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.
[In Permitted Property Type Values] PtypInteger32 defined in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1 is 0x0003 but 0x00000003 is used in the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.
[In Permitted Property Type Values] PtypBoolean defined in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1 is 0x000B but 0x0000000B is used in the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.
[In Permitted Property Type Values] PtypString8 defined in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1 is 0x001E but 0x0000001E is used in the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.
[In Permitted Property Type Values] PtypBinary defined in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1 is 0x0102 but 0x00000102 is used in the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.
[In Permitted Property Type Values] PtypString defined in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1 is 0x001F but 0x0000001F is used in the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.
[In Permitted Property Type Values] PtypTime defined in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1 is 0x0040 but 0x00000040 is used in the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.
[In Permitted Property Type Values] PtypErrorCode defined in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1 is 0x000A but 0x0000000A is used in the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.
[In Permitted Property Type Values] PtypMultipleString8 defined in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1 is 0x101E but 0x0000101E is used in the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.
[In Permitted Property Type Values] PtypMultipleBinary defined in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1 is 0x1102 but 0x00001102 is used in the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.
[In Permitted Property Type Values] PtypMultipleString defined in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1 is 0x101F but 0x0000101F is used in the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.

[In Permitted Property Type Values] In addition, all Exchange NSPI servers and clients MUST recognize and be capable of accepting and returning the property types that are listed in the following table [PtypEmbeddedTable, PtypNull and PtypUnspecified].
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1657.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Permitted Property Type Values] In addition to the property types that are defined in [MS-OXCDATA], the Exchange NSPI server under test MUST be capable of returning the property types [PtypEmbeddedTable, PtypNull and PtypUnspecified] that are listed in the following table.
[In Permitted Property Type Values] PtypEmbeddedTable ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1.5) property type with 0x0000000D value means single 32-bit value, referencing an address list.
[In Permitted Property Type Values] [PtypNull ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1) property type with 0x00000001 value] Clients MUST NOT specify this property type in any method's input parameters.

[In Permitted Property Type Values] [PtypNull ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1) property type with 0x00000001 value] The server MUST specify this property type in any method's output parameters to indicate that a property has a value that cannot be expressed in the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.

[In Permitted Property Type Values] [PtypUnspecified ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1) property type with 0x00000000 value] Clients specify this property type in a method's input parameter to indicate that the client will accept any property type the server chooses when returning propvalues.
[In Permitted Property Type Values] [PtypUnspecified ([MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.1) property type with 0x00000000 value] Servers MUST NOT specify this property type in any method's output parameters.

[In Permitted Property Type Values] All clients and servers MUST NOT use any other property types [other than PtypInteger32, PtypBoolean, PtypString8, PtypBinary, PtypString, PtypTime, PtypErrorCode, PtypMultipleString8, PtypMultipleBinary and PtypMultipleString].
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1658.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Permitted Property Type Values] The server under test MUST use the following property types [PtypInteger32, PtypBoolean, PtypString8, PtypBinary, PtypString, PtypTime, PtypErrorCode, PtypMultipleString8, PtypMultipleBinary and PtypMultipleString].

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Permitted Error Code Values] The values [Success, UnbindSuccess, UnbindFailure, ErrorsReturned, GeneralFailure, NotSupported, InvalidObject, OutOfResources, NotFound, LogonFailed, TooComplex, InvalidCodepage, InvalidLocale, TableTooBig, InvalidBookmark, AccessDenied, NotEnoughMemory and InvalidParameter] that represent the error codes are defined in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.4.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Permitted Error Code Values] The following are the permitted error code values for the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol: Success, UnbindSuccess, UnbindFailure, ErrorsReturned, GeneralFailure, NotSupported, InvalidObject, OutOfResources, NotFound, LogonFailed, TooComplex, InvalidCodepage, InvalidLocale, TableTooBig, InvalidBookmark, AccessDenied, NotEnoughMemory, InvalidParameter.
