[In Display Type Values] The values [DT_MAILUSER, DT_DISTLIST, DT_FORUM, DT_AGENT, DT_ORGANIZATION, DT_PRIVATE_DISTLIST, DT_REMOTE_MAILUSER, DT_CONTAINER, DT_TEMPLATE, DT_ADDRESS_TEMPLATE, DT_SEARCH] listed in this section are used to specify display types.

[In Display Type Values] They [DT_MAILUSER, DT_DISTLIST, DT_FORUM, DT_AGENT, DT_ORGANIZATION, DT_PRIVATE_DISTLIST, DT_REMOTE_MAILUSER, DT_CONTAINER, DT_TEMPLATE, DT_ADDRESS_TEMPLATE, DT_SEARCH] appear in various places in the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol as object properties and as part of EntryIDs.

[In Display Type Values] Except where otherwise specified in the following table, all Exchange NSPI servers MUST recognize and be capable of accepting and returning these display types. [DT_MAILUSER, DT_DISTLIST, DT_FORUM, DT_AGENT, DT_ORGANIZATION, DT_PRIVATE_DISTLIST, DT_REMOTE_MAILUSER, DT_CONTAINER, DT_TEMPLATE, DT_ADDRESS_TEMPLATE, DT_SEARCH]
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1662.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Display Type Values] Except where otherwise specified in the following table, the Exchange NSPI server under test MUST be capable of returning these display types [DT_MAILUSER, DT_DISTLIST, DT_FORUM, DT_AGENT, DT_ORGANIZATION, DT_PRIVATE_DISTLIST, DT_REMOTE_MAILUSER, DT_CONTAINER, DT_TEMPLATE, DT_ADDRESS_TEMPLATE, DT_SEARCH].

[In Display Type Values] The following table lists the permitted display type values [0x00000000, 0x00000001, 0x00000002, 0x00000003, 0x00000004, 0x00000005, 0x00000006, 0x00000100, 0x00000101, 0x00000102 and 0x00000200] for the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.
[In Display Type Values] DT_MAILUSER display type name with 0x00000000 means a typical messaging user.
[In Display Type Values] DT_DISTLIST display type name with 0x00000001 means a distribution list.
[In Display Type Values] DT_FORUM display type with 0x00000002 value means a forum, such as a bulletin board service or a public or shared folder.
[In Display Type Values] DT_AGENT display type with 0x00000003 value means an automated agent, such as Quote-Of-The-Day or a weather chart display.
[In Display Type Values] DT_ORGANIZATION display type with 0x00000004 value means an Address Book object defined for a large group, such as helpdesk, accounting, coordinator, or department.
[In Display Type Values] [DT_ORGANIZATION] Department objects usually have this display type.
[In Display Type Values] [DT_ORGANIZATION] An Exchange NSPI server MUST NOT return display type.
[In Display Type Values] DT_PRIVATE_DISTLIST display type with 0x00000005 value means a private, personally administered distribution list.
[In Display Type Values] DT_REMOTE_MAILUSER display type with 0x00000006 value means an Address Book object known to be from a foreign or remote messaging system.
[In Display Type Values] DT_CONTAINER display type with 0x00000100 value means an address book hierarchy table container.
[In Display Type Values] [DT_CONTAINER display type] An Exchange NSPI server MUST NOT return this display type except as part of an EntryID of an object in the address book hierarchy table.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-OXNSPI_R1998, MS-OXNSPI_R1999.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Display Type Values] Exchange NSPI server will return display type DT_CONTAINER as part of an EntryID of an object in the address book hierarchy table.
[In Display Type Values] Exchange NSPI server will not return display type DT_CONTAINER as part of an EntryID of an object if the table is not the address book hierarchy table.
[In Display Type Values] DT_TEMPLATE display type with 0x00000101 value means a display template object.
[In Display Type Values] [DT_TEMPLATE display type] An Exchange NSPI server MUST NOT return this display type.
[In Display Type Values] DT_ADDRESS_TEMPLATE display type with 0x00000102 value means an address creation template.
[In Display Type Values] [DT_ADDRESS_TEMPLATE display type] An Exchange NSPI server MUST NOT return this display type except as part of an EntryID of an object in the Address Creation Table.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirements: MS-OXNSPI_R1996, MS-OXNSPI_R1997.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Display Type Values] Exchange NSPI server will return display type DT_ADDRESS_TEMPLATE as part of an EntryID of an object in the Address Creation Table.
[In Display Type Values] Exchange NSPI server will not return display type DT_ADDRESS_TEMPLATE as part of an EntryID of an object if the table is not the Address Creation Table.
[In Display Type Values] DT_SEARCH display type with 0x00000200 value means a search template.
[In Display Type Values] [DT_SEARCH display type] An Exchange NSPI server MUST NOT return this display type.

[In Display Type Values] All clients and servers MUST NOT use any other display types [other than DT_MAILUSER, DT_DISTLIST, DT_FORUM, DT_AGENT, DT_ORGANIZATION, DT_PRIVATE_DISTLIST, DT_REMOTE_MAILUSER, DT_CONTAINER, DT_TEMPLATE, DT_ADDRESS_TEMPLATE and DT_SEARCH].
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1663.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Display Type Values] The server under test MUST use the following display types [DT_MAILUSER, DT_DISTLIST, DT_FORUM, DT_AGENT, DT_ORGANIZATION, DT_PRIVATE_DISTLIST, DT_REMOTE_MAILUSER, DT_CONTAINER, DT_TEMPLATE, DT_ADDRESS_TEMPLATE and DT_SEARCH].
[In Default Language Code Identifier] The language code identifier (LCID) [NSPI_DEFAULT_LOCALE] specified in this section is associated with the minimal required sort order for Unicode strings.
[In Default Language Code Identifier] It [LCID] appears in input parameters to Exchange Server NSPI Protocol methods.
[In Default Language Code Identifier] It [LCID] affects Exchange NSPI server string handling, as specified in section 3.1.4.3.
[In Default Language Code Identifier] The following table lists and describes the default LCID [NSPI_DEFAULT_LOCALE] for this protocol.
[In Default Language Code Identifier] NSPI_DEFAULT_LOCALE (0x00000409): Represents the default LCID that is used for comparison of Unicode string representations.

[In Required Code Pages] The required code pages [CP_TELETEX and CP_WINUNICODE] listed in this section are associated with the string handling in the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol, and they appear in input parameters to methods in the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.
[In Required Code Pages] They [CP_TELETEX and CP_WINUNICODE] affect Exchange NSPI server string handling, as specified in section 3.1.4.3.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXNSPI_R680, MS-OXNSPI_R732, MS-OXNSPI_R780, MS-OXNSPI_R873, MS-OXNSPI_R935, MS-OXNSPI_R1016, MS-OXNSPI_R1101, MS-OXNSPI_R1181, MS-OXNSPI_R1223, MS-OXNSPI_R1280, MS-OXNSPI_R1359, MS-OXNSPI_R1410, MS-OXNSPI_R1467.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Required Code Pages] The following table lists the required code pages [CP_TELETEX and CP_WINUNICODE].
[In Required Code Pages] CP_TELETEX (0x00004F25): Represents the Teletex code page.
[In Required Code Pages] CP_WINUNICODE (0x000004B0): Represents the Unicode code page.

[In Unicode Comparison Flags] These values [NORM_IGNORECASE, NORM_IGNOREKANATYPE, NORM_IGNORENONSPACE, NORM_IGNOREWIDTH, NORM_IGNORESYMBOLS and SORT_STRINGSORT] are associated with string handling in the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.

[In Unicode Comparison Flags] These values [NORM_IGNORECASE, NORM_IGNOREKANATYPE, NORM_IGNORENONSPACE, NORM_IGNOREWIDTH, NORM_IGNORESYMBOLS and SORT_STRINGSORT] are defined in terms of definitions, as specified in 2.2.1.6.1.

[In Unicode Comparison Flags] The server uses these flags [NSPI_DEFAULT_LOCALE_COMPARE_FLAGS and NSPI_NON_DEFAULT_LOCALE_COMPARE_FLAGS] to modify the behavior of comparisons of Unicode string representations, as detailed in section 3.1.4.3

[In Unicode Comparison Flags] Flag NSPI_DEFAULT_LOCALE_COMPARE_FLAGS has the following values: (NORM_IGNORECASE | \ NORM_IGNOREKANATYPE | \ NORM_IGNORENONSPACE | \ NORM_IGNOREWIDTH | \ SORT_STRINGSORT)
[In Unicode Comparison Flags] Flags [NSPI_DEFAULT_LOCALE_COMPARE_FLAGS] used when comparing Unicode strings in the language code identifier (LCID) represented by NSPI_DEFAULT_LOCALE.
[In Unicode Comparison Flags] The comparison flag values [NSPI_DEFAULT_LOCALE_COMPARE_FLAGS] are defined in section 2.2.6.1.

[In Unicode Comparison Flags] Flag NSPI_NON_DEFAULT_LOCALE_COMPARE_FLAGS has the following values: (NORM_IGNORECASE | \ NORM_IGNOREKANATYPE | \ NORM_IGNORENONSPACE | \ NORM_IGNOREWIDTH | \ NORM_IGNORESYMBOLS | \ SORT_STRINGSORT)
[In Unicode Comparison Flags] [NSPI_NON_DEFAULT_LOCALE_COMPARE_FLAGS] Flags used when comparing Unicode strings in any LCID except the LCID represented by NSPI_DEFAULT_LOCALE.
[In Unicode Comparison Flags] [NSPI_NON_DEFAULT_LOCALE_COMPARE_FLAGS] The comparison flag values are defined in section 2.2.1.6.1.
[In Comparison Flags] The following defines the bit settings and meaning of the bits used by the Unicode comparison flags.
[In Comparison Flags] The flags are presented in big-endian byte order.
[In Comparison Flags] V (1 bit): NORM IGNORECASE: Ignore Case.
[In Comparison Flags] U (1 bit): NORM IGNORENONSPACE: Ignore non-spacing characters.
[In Comparison Flags] T (1 bit): NORM IGNORESYMBOLS: Ignore symbols.
[In Comparison Flags] S (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] R (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] Q (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] P (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] O (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] N (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] M (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] L (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] K (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] J (1 bit): SORT STRINGSORT: Treat punctuation the same as symbols.
[In Comparison Flags] I (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] H (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] G (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] F (1 bit): NORM IGNOREKANATYPE: Do not differentiate between hiragana and katakana characters.
[In Comparison Flags] [F (1 bit): NORM IGNOREKANATYPE] Corresponding hiragana and katakana characters compare as equal.
[In Comparison Flags] E (1 bit): NORM IGNOREWIDTH: Ignore the difference between half-width and full-width characters.
[In Comparison Flags] D (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] C (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] B (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] A (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] 9 (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] 8 (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] 7 (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] 6 (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] 5 (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] 4 (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] 3 (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] 2 (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] 1 (1 bit): Unused.
[In Comparison Flags] 0 (1 bit): Unused.
[In Permanent Entry ID GUID] The following table lists the Permanent Entry ID that is associated with the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.

[In Permanent Entry ID GUID] GUID_NSPI ({0xDC, 0xA7, 0x40, 0xC8, 0xC0, 0x42, 0x10, 0x1A, 0xB4, 0xB9, 0x08, 0x00, 0x2B, 0x2F, 0xE1, 0x82}): Represents the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol in Permanent Entry IDs.

[In Positioning Minimal Entry IDs] The positioning Minimal Entry IDs [MID_BEGINNING_OF_TABLE, MID_END_OF_TABLE and MID_CURRENT] are used to specify objects in the address book as a function of their positions in tables.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXNSPI_R80, MS-OXNSPI_R81.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Positioning Minimal Entry IDs] They [MID_BEGINNING_OF_TABLE, MID_END_OF_TABLE and MID_CURRENT] appear as Minimal Entry IDs in the CurrentRec field of the STAT structure, as specified in section 2.2.8.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R319.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Positioning Minimal Entry IDs] The following table lists the possible values [MID_BEGINNING_OF_TABLE, MID_END_OF_TABLE and MID_CURRENT].
[In Positioning Minimal Entry IDs] MID_BEGINNING_OF_TABLE (0x00000000): Specifies the position before the first row in the current address book container.
[In Positioning Minimal Entry IDs] MID_END_OF_TABLE (0x00000002): Specifies the position after the last row in the current address book container.
[In Positioning Minimal Entry IDs] MID_CURRENT (0x00000001): Specifies the current position in a table.
[In Positioning Minimal Entry IDs] [MID_CURRENT] This Minimal Entry ID is only valid in the NspiUpdateStat method, as specified in section 3.1.4.1.4.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1742.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Positioning Minimal Entry IDs] [MID_CURRENT] This Minimal Entry ID is valid in the NspiUpdateStat method.

[In Positioning Minimal Entry IDs] [MID_CURRENT] In all other cases [in all the methods except NspiUpdateStat method], it is an invalid Minimal Entry ID, guaranteed to not specify any object in the address book.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1985.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Positioning Minimal Entry IDs] [MID_CURRENT] For method NspiGetProps, it is an invalid Minimal Entry ID, guaranteed to not specify any object in the address book.
[In Ambiguous Name Resolution Minimal Entry IDs] Ambiguous name resolution (ANR) Minimal Entry IDs [MID_UNRESOLVED, MID_AMBIGUOUS and MID_RESOLVED] are used to specify the outcome of the ANR process.

[In Ambiguous Name Resolution Minimal Entry IDs] They [MID_UNRESOLVED, MID_AMBIGUOUS and MID_RESOLVED] appear in return data from the NspiResolveNames method, as specified in section 3.1.4.1.16, and the NspiResolveNamesw method, as specified in section 3.1.4.1.17.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXNSPI_R1342, MS-OXNSPI_R1393.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Ambiguous Name Resolution Minimal Entry IDs] The following table lists the possible values [MID_UNRESOLVED, MID_AMBIGUOUS and MID_RESOLVED].
[In Ambiguous Name Resolution Minimal Entry IDs] MID_UNRESOLVED (0x00000000): The ANR process was unable to map a string to any objects in the address book.
[In Ambiguous Name Resolution Minimal Entry IDs] MID_AMBIGUOUS (0x0000001): The ANR process mapped a string to multiple objects in the address book.
[In Ambiguous Name Resolution Minimal Entry IDs] MID_RESOLVED (0x0000002): The ANR process mapped a string to a single object in the address book.

[In Table Sort Orders] The following table lists the values [SortTypeDisplayName, SortTypePhoneticDisplayName, SortTypeDisplayName_RO and SortTypeDisplayName_W] that are used to specify specific sort orders for tables.

[In Table Sort Orders] These values [SortTypeDisplayName, SortTypePhoneticDisplayName, SortTypeDisplayName_RO and SortTypeDisplayName_W] appear in the SortType field of the STAT data structure, as specified in section 2.2.8.
[In Table Sort Orders] SortTypeDisplayName (0x00000000): The table is sorted ascending on the PidTagDisplayName property, as specified in [MS-OXCFOLD] section 2.2.2.2.2.5.
[In Table Sort Orders] [SortTypeDisplayName] All Exchange NSPI servers MUST support this sort order [ascending on the PidTagDisplayName property] for at least one LCID.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1749.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Table Sort Orders] The Exchange NSPI server under test MUST support this sort order [ascending on the PidTagDisplayName property] for the default LCID NSPI_DEFAULT_LOCALE.
[In Table Sort Orders] SortTypePhoneticDisplayName (0x00000003): The table is sorted ascending on the PidTagAddressBookPhoneticDisplayName property, as specified in [MS-OXOABK] section 2.2.3.9.
[In Table Sort Orders] [SortTypePhoneticDisplayName] Exchange NSPI servers SHOULD support this sort order [ascending on the PidTagAddressBookPhoneticDisplayName property].
[In Table Sort Orders] SortTypeDisplayName_RO (0x000003E8): The table is sorted ascending on the PidTagDisplayName property.

[In Table Sort Orders] [SortTypeDisplayName_RO] The client MUST set this value only when using the NspiGetMatches method, as specified in section 3.1.4.1.10, to open a nonwritable table on an object-valued property.
[In Table Sort Orders] SortTypeDisplayName_W (0x000003E9): The table is sorted ascending on the PidTagDisplayName property.
[In Table Sort Orders] [SortTypeDisplayName_W] The client MUST set this value only when using the NspiGetMatches method to open a writable table on an object-valued property.
[In Retrieve Property Flags] The following table lists the property flag values [fSkipObjects and fEphID] that are used to specify optional behavior to a server.
[In Retrieve Property Flags] They [fSkipObjects and fEphID] appear as bit flags in methods that return property values to the client (NspiGetPropList, NspiGetProps, and NspiQueryRows).

[In Retrieve Property Flags] fSkipObjects (0x00000001): Client requires that the server MUST NOT include proptags with the PtypEmbeddedTable property type in any lists of proptags that the server creates on behalf of the client.
[In Retrieve Property Flags] fEphID (0x00000002): Client requires that the server MUST return Entry ID values in Ephemeral Entry ID form.
[In NspiGetSpecialTable Flags] NspiGetSpecialTable flag values [NspiAddressCreationTemplates and NspiUnicodeStrings] are used to specify optional behavior to a server.
[In NspiGetSpecialTable Flags] They [NspiAddressCreationTemplates and NspiUnicodeStrings] appear as bit flags in the NspiGetSpecialTable method, as specified in section 3.1.4.1.3.
[In NspiGetSpecialTable Flags] The following table lists the possible values [NspiAddressCreationTemplates and NspiUnicodeStrings].
[In NspiGetSpecialTable Flags] NspiAddressCreationTemplates (0x00000002): Specifies that the server MUST return the table of the available address creation templates.
[In NspiGetSpecialTable Flags] NspiAddressCreationTemplates (0x00000002): Specifying this flag causes the server to ignore the NspiUnicodeStrings flag.

[In NspiGetSpecialTable Flags] NspiUnicodeStrings (0x00000004): Specifies that the server MUST return all strings as Unicode representations rather than as multibyte strings in the client's code page.
[In NspiQueryColumns Flag] The NspiQueryColumns flag value [NspiUnicodeProptypes] is used to specify optional behavior to a server.
[In NspiQueryColumns Flag] It [the NspiQueryColumns flag] appears as a bit flag in the NspiQueryColumns method.
[In NspiQueryColumns Flag] The following table lists the value [NspiUnicodeProptypes] for this flag [NspiQueryColumns].

[In NspiQueryColumns Flag] NspiUnicodeProptypes (0x80000000): Specifies that the server MUST return all proptags that specify values with string representations as having the PtypString property type.
[In NspiQueryColumns Flag] If the NspiUnicodeProptypes flag is not set, the server MUST return all proptags specifying values with string representations as having the PtypString8 property type.
[In NspiGetTemplateInfo Flags] The NspiGetTemplateInfo flag values [TI_TEMPLATE, TI_SCRIPT, TI_EMT, TI_HELPFILE_NAME and TI_HELPFILE_CONTENTS] are used to specify optional behavior to a server.
[In NspiGetTemplateInfo Flags] They [TI_TEMPLATE, TI_SCRIPT, TI_EMT, TI_HELPFILE_NAME and TI_HELPFILE_CONTENTS] appear as bit flags in the NspiGetTemplateInfo method.
[In NspiGetTemplateInfo Flags] The following table lists the possible values [TI_TEMPLATE, TI_SCRIPT, TI_EMT, TI_HELPFILE_NAME and TI_HELPFILE_CONTENTS].
[In NspiGetTemplateInfo Flags] TI_TEMPLATE (0x00000001): Specifies that the server is to return the value that represents a template.
[In NspiGetTemplateInfo Flags] TI_SCRIPT (0x00000004): Specifies that the server is to return the value of the script that is associated with a template.
[In NspiGetTemplateInfo Flags] TI_EMT (0x00000010): Specifies that the server is to return the e-mail type that is associated with a template.
[In NspiGetTemplateInfo Flags] TI_HELPFILE_NAME (0x00000020): Specifies that the server is to return the name of the help file that is associated with a template.
[In NspiGetTemplateInfo Flags] TI_HELPFILE_CONTENTS (0x00000040): Specifies that the server is to return the contents of the help file that is associated with a template.
[In NspiModLinkAtt Flags] The NspiModLinkAtt flag value is used to specify optional behavior to a server.
[In NspiModLinkAtt Flags] It [the NspiModLinkAtt flag] appears as a bit flag in the NspiModLinkAtt method.
[In NspiModLinkAtt Flags] The following table lists the value [fDelete] of the flag.
[In NspiModLinkAtt Flags] fDelete (0x00000001): Specifies that the server is to remove values when modifying.
[In NspiModLinkAtt Flags] If the fDelete flag is not set, the server adds values when modifying.

[In Property Values] The following structures [FlatUID_r, PropertyTagArray_r, Binary_r, ShortArray_r, LongArray_r, StringArray_r, BinaryArray_r, FlatUIDArray_r, WStringArray_r, DateTimeArray_r, PROP_VAL_UNION and PropertyValue_r] are used to represent specific property values.
[In FlatUID_r Structure] The FlatUID_r structure is an encoding of the FlatUID_r data structure defined in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.5.2.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCDATA_R10.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In FlatUID_r Structure] The semantic meaning is unchanged from the FlatUID data structure.
[In FlatUID_r Structure] ab: Encodes the ordered bytes of the FlatUID data structure.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCDATA_R10.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PropertyTagArray_r Structure] The PropertyTagArray_r structure is an encoding of the PropTagArray_r data structure defined in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.10.2.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCDATA_R189, MS-OXCDATA_R191.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PropertyTagArray_r Structure] The permissible number of proptag values in the PropertyTagArray_r structure exceeds that of the PropertyTagArray_r data structure.
[In PropertyTagArray_r Structure] The semantic meaning is otherwise unchanged from the PropertyTagArray_r data structure.
[In PropertyTagArray_r Structure] cValues: Encodes the Count field of the PropertyTagArray_r data structure.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCDATA_R189.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PropertyTagArray_r Structure] aulPropTag: Encodes the PropertyTags field of the PropertyTagArray_r data structure.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCDATA_R191.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Binary_r Structure] The Binary_r structure encodes an array of uninterpreted bytes.
[In Binary_r Structure] cb: The number of uninterpreted bytes represented in this structure.
[In Binary_r Structure] [cb] This value MUST NOT exceed 2,097,152.
[In Binary_r Structure] lpb: The uninterpreted bytes.
[In ShortArray_r Structure] The ShortArray_r structure encodes an array of 16-bit integers.
[In ShortArray_r Structure] cValues: The number of 16-bit integer values represented in the ShortArray_r structure.
[In ShortArray_r Structure] [cValue] This value MUST NOT exceed 100,000.
[In ShortArray_r Structure] lpi: The 16-bit integer values.
[In LongArray_r Structure] The LongArray_r structure encodes an array of 32-bit integers.
[In LongArray_r Structure] cValues: The number of 32-bit integers represented in this structure.
[In LongArray_r Structure] [cValue] This value MUST NOT exceed 100,000.
[In LongArray_r Structure] lpl: The 32-bit integer values.
[In StringArray_r Structure] The StringArray_r structure encodes an array of references to 8-bit character strings.
[In StringArray_r Structure] cValues: The number of 8-bit character string references represented in the StringArray_r structure.
[In StringArray_r Structure] [cValues] This value MUST NOT exceed 100,000.
[In StringArray_r Structure] lppszA: The 8-bit character string references.
[In StringArray_r Structure] [lppszA] The strings referred to are NULL-terminated.
[In BinaryArray_r Structure] The BinaryArray_r structure is an array of Binary_r data structures.
[In BinaryArray_r Structure] cValues: The number of Binary_r data structures represented in the BinaryArray_r structure.
[In BinaryArray_r Structure] [cValues] This value MUST NOT exceed 100,000.
[In BinaryArray_r Structure] lpbin: The Binary_r data structures.
[In FlatUIDArray_r Structure] The FlatUIDArray_r structure encodes an array of FlatUID_r data structures.
[In FlatUIDArray_r Structure] cValues: The number of FlatUID_r structures represented in the FlatUIDArray_r structure.
[In FlatUIDArray_r Structure] [cValues] This value MUST NOT exceed 100,000.
[In FlatUIDArray_r Structure] lpguid: The FlatUID_r data structures.
[In WStringArray_r Structure] The WStringArray_r structure encodes an array of references to Unicode strings.
[In WStringArray_r Structure] cValues: The number of Unicode character string references represented in the WStringArray_r structure.
[In WStringArray_r Structure] [cValues]This value MUST NOT exceed 100,000.
[In WStringArray_r Structure] lppszW: The Unicode character string references.
[In WStringArray_r Structure] [ppszW] The strings referred to are NULL-terminated.
[In DateTimeArray_r Structure] The DateTimeArray_r structure encodes an array of FILETIME structures.
[In DateTimeArray_r Structure] cValues: The number of FILETIME data structures represented in the DateTimeArray_r structure.
[In DateTimeArray_r Structure] [cValues] This value MUST NOT exceed 100,000.
[In DateTimeArray_r Structure] lpft: The FILETIME data structures.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] The PROP_VAL_UNION structure encodes a single instance of any type of property value.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1572.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] It [PROP_VAL_UNION] is an aggregation data structure, allowing a single parameter to an NSPI method to contain any type of property value.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1572.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] l: PROP_VAL_UNION contains an encoding of the value of a property that can contain a single 32-bit integer value.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] b: PROP_VAL_UNION contains an encoding of the value of a property that can contain a single Boolean value.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [b] The client and server MUST NOT set this to values other than 1 or 0.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] lpszA: PROP_VAL_UNION contains an encoding of the value of a property that can contain a single 8-bit character string value.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [lpszA] This value is NULL-terminated.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] bin: PROP_VAL_UNION contains an encoding of the value of a property that can contain a single binary data value.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [bin] The number of bytes that can be encoded in this structure is 2,097,152.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] lpszW: PROP_VAL_UNION contains an encoding of the value of a property that can contain a single Unicode string value.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [lpszW] This value is NULL-terminated.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] lpguid: PROP_VAL_UNION contains an encoding of the value of a property that can contain a single GUID value.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [lpguid] The value is encoded as a FlatUID_r data structure.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] ft: PROP_VAL_UNION contains an encoding of the value of a property that can contain a single 64-bit integer value.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [ft] The value is encoded as a FILETIME structure.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] err: PROP_VAL_UNION contains an encoding of the value of a property that can contain a single PtypErrorCode value.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] MVi: PROP_VAL_UNION contains an encoding of the values of a property that can contain multiple 16-bit integer values.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [MVi] The number of values that can be encoded in this structure is 100,000.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] MVl: PROP_VAL_UNION contains an encoding of the values of a property that can contain multiple 32-bit integer values.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [MVl] The number of values that can be encoded in this structure is 100,000.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] MVszA: PROP_VAL_UNION contains an encoding of the values of a property that can contain multiple 8-bit character string values.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [MVszA] These string values [values of a property] are NULL-terminated.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [MVszA] The number of values that can be encoded in this structure is 100,000.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] MVbin: PROP_VAL_UNION contains an encoding of the values of a property that can contain multiple binary data values.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [MVbin] The number of bytes that can be encoded in each value of this structure is 2,097,152.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [MVbin] The number of values that can be encoded in this structure is 100,000.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] MVguid: PROP_VAL_UNION contains an encoding of the values of a property that can contain multiple GUID values.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [MVguid] The values are encoded as FlatUID_r data structures.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [MVguid] The number of values that can be encoded in this structure is 100,000.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] MVszW: PROP_VAL_UNION contains an encoding of the values of a property that can contain multiple Unicode string values.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [MVszW] These string values [values of a property] are NULL-terminated.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [MVszW] The number of values that can be encoded in this structure is 100,000.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] MVft: PROP_VAL_UNION contains an encoding of the value of a property that can contain multiple 64-bit integer values.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [MVft] The values are encoded as FILETIME structures.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [MVft] The number of values that can be encoded in this structure is 100,000.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] lReserved: [means this filed is] Reserved.
[In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] [IReserved] All clients and servers MUST set this value [lReserved] to the constant 0x00000000.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1707.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PROP_VAL_UNION Structure] The server under test MUST set this value [lReserved] to the constant 0x00000000.
[In PropertyValue_r Structure] The PropertyValue_r structure is an encoding of the PropertyValue_r data structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.11.2.2.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCDATA_R456, MS-OXCDATA_R457, MS-OXNSPI_R458.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PropertyValue_r Structure] For property values with uninterpreted byte values, the permissible number of bytes in the PropertyValue_r structure exceeds that of the PropertyValue data structure.
[In PropertyValue_r Structure] For property values with multiple values, the permissible number of values in the PropertyValue_r structure exceeds that of the PropertyValue data structure.
[In PropertyValue_r Structure] The semantic meaning is otherwise unchanged from the PropertyValue data structure.
[In PropertyValue_r Structure] ulPropTag: Encodes the proptag of the property whose value is represented by the PropertyValue_r data structure.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCDATA_R456.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PropertyValue_r Structure] ulReserved: [means this filed is] Reserved.
[In PropertyValue_r Structure] [ulReserved] All clients and servers MUST set this value [ulReserved] to the constant 0x00000000.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1708.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PropertyValue_r Structure] The server under test MUST set this value [ulReserved] to the constant 0x00000000.
[In PropertyValue_r Structure] Value: Encodes the actual value of the property represented by the PropertyValue_r data structure.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCDATA_R458.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PropertyValue_r Structure] [Value] The type value held is specified by the property type of the proptag in the ulPropTag field.
[In PropertyRow_r Structure] The PropertyRow_r structure is an encoding of the StandardPropertyRow data structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.8.1.1.
[In PropertyRow_r Structure] The semantic meaning is unchanged from the StandardPropertyRow data structure.
[In PropertyRow_r Structure] Reserved: Reserved.
[In PropertyRow_r Structure] [Reserved] All clients and servers MUST set this value to the constant 0x00000000.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1709.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PropertyRow_r Structure] [Reserved] The server under test MUST set this value to the constant 0x00000000.
[In PropertyRow_r Structure] cValues: The number of PropertyValue_r structures represented in the PropertyRow_r structure.
[In PropertyRow_r Structure] [cValues] This value MUST NOT exceed 100,000.
[In PropertyRow_r Structure] lpProps: Encodes the ValueArray field of the StandardPropertyRow data structure.
[In PropertyRowSet_r Structure] The PropertyRowSet_r structure is an encoding of the PropertyRowSet_r data structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.8.2.2.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXCDATA_R97, MS-OXCDATA_R99.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PropertyRowSet_r Structure] The permissible number of PropertyRows in the PropertyRowSet_r data structure exceeds that of the PropertyRowSet data structure.
[In PropertyRowSet_r Structure] The semantic meaning is otherwise unchanged from the PropertyRowSet data structure.
[In PropertyRowSet_r Structure] cRows: Encodes the RowCount field of the PropertyRowSet data structures.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCDATA_R97.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PropertyRowSet_r Structure] [cRows] This value MUST NOT exceed 100,000.
[In PropertyRowSet_r Structure] aRow: Encodes the Rows field of the PropertyRowSet data structure.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXCDATA_R99.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Restrictions] The following structures [AndRestriction_r Restriction, OrRestriction_r Restriction, NotRestriction_r Restriction, ContentRestriction_r Restriction, PropertyRestriction_r Restriction, ExistRestriction_r Restriction, RestrictionUnion_r Restriction and Restriction_r Restriction] are used to represent restrictions of a table, as defined in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.12.
[In AndRestriction_r Restriction] The AndRestriction_r, OrRestriction_r restriction types share a single RPC encoding.

[In AndRestriction_r Restriction] The AndOrRestriction_r structure is an encoding of the both the AndRestriction_r data structure and the OrRestriction_r data structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] sections 2.12.1.2 and 2.12.2.2.
[In AndRestriction_r Restriction] These two data structures [AndRestriction_r and OrRestriction_r] share the same data layout, so a single encoding is included in the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol.
[In AndRestriction_r Restriction] The sense of the data structure's use is derived from the context of its inclusion in the RestrictionUnion_r data structure, as specified in section 2.2.5.6.

[In AndRestriction_r Restriction] The permissible number of restriction structures in the AndRestriction_r and OrRestriction_r data structures exceeds that of the AndRestriction and OrRestriction structures.
[In AndRestriction_r Restriction] The semantic meaning is otherwise unchanged from the AndRestriction and OrRestriction data structures, as context dictates.
[In AndRestriction_r Restriction] cRes: Encodes the RestrictCount field of the AndRestriction and OrRestriction data structures.
[In AndRestriction_r Restriction] [cRes] This value MUST NOT exceed 100,000.
[In AndRestriction_r Restriction] lpRes: Encodes the Restricts field of the AndRestriction and OrRestriction data structures.
[In NotRestriction_r Restriction] The NotRestriction_r structure is an encoding of the NotRestriction _r data structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.12.3.2.
[In NotRestriction_r Restriction] The semantic meaning is unchanged from the NotRestriction data structure.
[In NotRestriction_r Restriction] lpRes: Encodes the Restriction field of the NotRestriction data structure.
[In ContentRestriction_r Restriction] The ContentRestriction_r structure is an encoding of the ContentRestriction_r data structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.12.4.2.
[In ContentRestriction_r Restriction] The semantic meaning is unchanged from the ContentRestriction data structure.
[In ContentRestriction_r Restriction] ulFuzzyLevel: Encodes the FuzzyLevelLow and FuzzyLevelHigh fields of the ContentRestriction data structure.
[In ContentRestriction_r Restriction] FuzzyLevelLow: Encodes the FuzzyLevelLow field of the ContentRestriction data structure.
[In ContentRestriction_r Restriction] FuzzyLevelHigh: Encodes the FuzzyLevelHigh field of the ContentRestriction data structure.
[In ContentRestriction_r Restriction] R1: [means this filed is] Reserved.
[In ContentRestriction_r Restriction] [R1] All clients MUST set this value to the constant 0x00.
[In ContentRestriction_r Restriction] ulPropTag: Encodes the PropertyTag field of the ContentRestriction data structure.
[In ContentRestriction_r Restriction] lpProp: Encodes the TaggedValue field of the ContentRestriction data structure.
[In PropertyRestriction_r Restriction] The PropertyRestriction_r structure is an encoding of the PropertyRestriction_r data structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.12.5.2.
[In PropertyRestriction_r Restriction] The semantic meaning is unchanged from the PropertyRestriction data structure.
[In PropertyRestriction_r Restriction] relop: Encodes the RelOp field of the PropertyRestriction data structure.
[In PropertyRestriction_r Restriction] ulPropTag: Encodes the PropTag field of the PropertyRestriction data structure.
[In PropertyRestriction_r Restriction] lpProp: Encodes the TaggedValue field of the PropertyRestriction data structure.
[In ExistRestriction_r Restriction] The ExistRestriction_r structure is an encoding of the ExistRestriction_r data structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.12.9.2.
[In ExistRestriction_r Restriction] The semantic meaning is unchanged from the ExistRestriction data structure.
[In ExistRestriction_r Restriction] ulReserved1: [means this filed is] Reserved.
[In ExistRestriction_r Restriction] [ulReserved1] All clients MUST set this value to the constant 0x00000000.
[In ExistRestriction_r Restriction] ulPropTag: Encodes the PropTag field of the ExistRestriction data structure.
[In ExistRestriction_r Restriction] ulReserved2: [means this filed is] Reserved.
[In ExistRestriction_r Restriction] [ulReserved2] All clients MUST set this value to the constant 0x00000000.
[In RestrictionUnion_r Restriction] The RestrictionUnion_r structure encodes a single instance of any type of restriction.
[In RestrictionUnion_r Restriction] It [RestrictionUnion_r] is an aggregation data structure, allowing a single parameter to an NSPI method to contain any type of restriction data structure.
[In RestrictionUnion_r Restriction] resAnd: RestrictionUnion_r contains an encoding of an AndRestriction.
[In RestrictionUnion_r Restriction] resOr: RestrictionUnion_r contains an encoding of an OrRestriction.
[In RestrictionUnion_r Restriction] resNot: RestrictionUnion_r contains an encoding of a NotRestriction.
[In RestrictionUnion_r Restriction] resContent: RestrictionUnion_r contains an encoding of a ContentRestriction.
[In RestrictionUnion_r Restriction] resProperty: RestrictionUnion_r contains an encoding of a PropertyRestriction.
[In RestrictionUnion_r Restriction] resExist: RestrictionUnion_r contains an encoding of an ExistRestriction.
[In Restriction_r Restriction] The Restriction_r structure is an encoding of the Restriction filters, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.12.

[In Restriction_r Restriction] The permissible number of Restriction structures encoded in AndRestriction_r and OrRestriction_r data structures recursively included in the Restriction_r data type exceeds that of the AndRestriction_r and OrRestriction_r data structures recursively included in the Restriction filters.
[In Restriction_r Restriction] The semantic meaning is otherwise unchanged from the Restriction filters.
[In Restriction_r Restriction] rt: Encodes the RestrictType field common to all restriction structures.
[In Restriction_r Restriction] res: Encodes the actual restriction specified by the type in the rt field.
[In Property Name/Property ID Structures] The following structures [PropertyName_r Structure] are used to represent named properties, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.6.
[In PropertyName_r Structure] The PropertyName_r structure is an encoding of the PropertyName_r data structure, as specified in [MS-OXCDATA] section 2.6.2.
[In PropertyName_r Structure] The semantic meaning is unchanged from the PropertyName data structure.
[In PropertyName_r Structure] lpguid: Encodes the GUID field of the PropertyName data structure.
[In PropertyName_r Structure] [lpguid] This field is encoded as a FlatUID_r data structure.
[In PropertyName_r Structure] ulReserved: [means this field is] Reserved.
[In PropertyName_r Structure] [ulReserved] All clients MUST set this value to the constant 0x00000000.
[In PropertyName_r Structure] lID: Encodes the lID field of the PropertyName data structure.
[In PropertyName_r Structure] [lID] In addition to the definition of the LID field, this field [LID] is always present in the PropertyName_r data structure; it [LID] is not optional.
[In String Arrays] The following structures [StringArray_r and WStringArray_r] are used to aggregate a number of strings into a single data structure.
[In StringsArray_r] The StringsArray_r structure is used to aggregate a number of character type strings into a single data structure.
[In StringsArray_r] Count: The number of character string structures in this aggregation.
[In StringsArray_r] [Count] The value MUST NOT exceed 100,000.
[In StringsArray_r] Strings: The list of character type strings in this aggregation.
[In StringsArray_r] [Strtings] The strings in this list are NULL-terminated.
[In WStringsArray_r] The WStringsArray_r structure is used to aggregate a number of wchar_t type strings into a single data structure.
[In WStringsArray_r] Count: The number of character strings structures in this aggregation.
[In WStringsArray_r] [Count] The value MUST NOT exceed 100,000.
[In WStringsArray_r] Strings: The list of wchar_t type strings in this aggregation.
[In WStringsArray_r] [Strings] The strings in this list are NULL-terminated.
[In STAT] The STAT structure is used to specify the state of a table and location information that applies to that table.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXNSPI_R773, MS-OXNSPI_R922, MS-OXNSPI_R1003, MS-OXNSPI_R1081, MS-OXNSPI_R1172.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In STAT] It [the STAT structure] appears as both an input parameter and an output parameter in many NSPI methods.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXNSPI_R784, MS-OXNSPI_R796, MS-OXNSPI_R797, MS-OXNSPI_R798, MS-OXNSPI_R799, MS-OXNSPI_R1050, MS-OXNSPI_R1051, MS-OXNSPI_R1052, MS-OXNSPI_R1054, MS-OXNSPI_R1055.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In STAT] SortType: This field contains a DWORD [MS-DTYP] value that represents a sort order.
[In STAT] [SortType] The client sets this field to specify the sort type of this table.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXNSPI_R93, MS-OXNSPI_R95, MS-OXNSPI_R98, MS-OXNSPI_R100.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In STAT] [SortType] Possible values are specified in section 2.2.1.10.
[In STAT] [SortType] The server MUST NOT modify this field.
[In STAT] ContainerID: This field contains a Minimal Entry ID.
[In STAT] [ContainerID] The client sets this field to specify the Minimal Entry ID of the address book container that this STAT structure represents.
[In STAT] [ContainerID] The client obtains these Minimal Entry IDs [Minimal Entry ID of the address book container] from the server's address book hierarchy table.
[In STAT] [ContainerID] The server MUST NOT modify this field in any NSPI method except the NspiGetMatches method.
[In STAT] CurrentRec: This field contains a Minimal Entry ID.
[In STAT] [CurrentRec] The client sets this field to specify a beginning position in the table for the start of an NSPI method.
[In STAT] [CurrentRec] The server sets this field to report the end position in the table after processing an NSPI method.
[In STAT] Delta: This field contains a long value.
[In STAT] [Delta] The client sets this field to specify an offset from the beginning position in the table for the start of an NSPI method.
[In STAT] [Delta] If the NSPI method returns a success value, the server MUST set this field to 0.
[In STAT] NumPos: This field contains a DWORD value that specifies a position in the table.
[In STAT] [NumPos] The client sets this field to specify a fractional position for the beginning position in the table for the start of an NSPI method, as specified in section 3.1.4.5.2.
[In STAT] [NumPos] If absolute positioning, as specified in section 3.1.4.5.1, is used, the value of this field specified by the client will be ignored by the server.
[In STAT] [NumPos] The server sets this field to specify the approximate fractional position at the end of an NSPI method.
[In STAT] [NumPos] This value [the approximate fractional position] is a zero index; the first element in a table has the numeric position 0.

[In STAT] [NumPos] Although the protocol places no boundary or requirements on the accuracy of the approximation the server reports, it is recommended that implementations maximize the accuracy of the approximation to improve usability of the server for clients.
[In STAT] TotalRecs: This field contains a DWORD value that specifies the number of rows in the table.
[In STAT] [TotalRecs] The client sets this field to specify a fractional position for the beginning position in the table for the start of an NSPI method, as specified in section 3.1.4.5.2.
[In STAT] [TotalRecs] If absolute positioning, as specified in section 3.1.4.5.1, is used, the value of this field specified by the client will be ignored by the server.
[In STAT] [TotalRecs] The server sets this field to specify the total number of rows in the table.
[In STAT] [TotalRecs] Unlike the NumPos field, the server MUST report this number accurately; an approximation is insufficient.
[In STAT] CodePage: This field contains a DWORD value that represents a code page.
[In STAT] [CodePage] The client sets this field to specify the code page the client uses for non-Unicode strings.
[In STAT] [CodePage] The server MUST use this value during string handling, as specified in section 3.1.4.3.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXNSPI_R1933, MS-OXNSPI_R1934, MS-OXNSPI_R1935, MS-OXNSPI_R1936, MS-OXNSPI_R1937, MS-OXNSPI_R1938, MS-OXNSPI_R1939.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In STAT] [CodePage] The server MUST NOT modify this field.
[In STAT] TemplateLocale: This field contains a DWORD value that represents a language code identifier (LCID).
[In STAT] [TemplateLocale] The client sets this field to specify the LCID associated with the template the client wants the server to return.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXNSPI_R757, MS-OXNSPI_R758.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In STAT] [TemplateLocale] The server MUST NOT modify this field.
[In STAT] SortLocale: This field contains a DWORD value that represents an LCID.
[In STAT] [SortLocale] The client sets this field to specify the LCID that it [client] wants the server to use when sorting any strings.
[In STAT] [SortLocale] The server MUST use this value during sorting, as specified in section 3.1.4.3.
[In STAT] [SortLocale] The server MUST NOT modify this field.
[In EntryIDs] Each object in the address book is identified by one or more EntryIDs, as specified in section 3.1.4.6.
[In EntryIDs] The following table lists the three types of EntryIDs [MinimalEntryID, EphemeralEntryID and PermanentEntryID].
[In EntryIDs] MinimalEntryID: A minimal identifier
[In EntryIDs] EphemeralEntryID: An ephemeral identifier
[In EntryIDs] PermanentEntryID: A permanent identifier
[In MinimalEntryID] A Minimal Entry ID is a single DWORD value that identifies a specific object in the address book.
[In MinimalEntryID] Minimal Entry IDs with values less than 0x00000010 are used by clients as signals to trigger specific behaviors in specific NSPI methods.

[In MinimalEntryID] Except in those places where the protocol defines a specific behavior for these Minimal Entry IDs [Minimal Entry IDs with values less than 0x00000010], the server MUST treat these Minimal Entry IDs [Minimal Entry IDs with values less than 0x00000010] as Minimal Entry IDs that do not specify an object in the address book.
[In MinimalEntryID] Specific values used in this way are defined in sections 2.2.1.8 and 2.2.1.9.
[In MinimalEntryID] Minimal Entry IDs are created and assigned by Exchange NSPI server.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R603.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In MinimalEntryID] The algorithm used by a server to create a Minimal Entry ID is not restricted by this protocol.

[In MinimalEntryID] A Minimal Entry ID is valid only to servers that respond to an NspiBind method, as specified in section 3.1.4.1.1, with the same server GUID as that used by the server that created the Minimal Entry ID.
[In MinimalEntryID] It is not possible for a client to predict a Minimal Entry ID.
[In MinimalEntryID] This type [MinimalEntryID] is declared as follows: typedef DWORD MinEntryID;
[In EphemeralEntryID] The EphemeralEntryID structure identifies a specific object in the address book.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R605.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In EphemeralEntryID] Additionally, it [EphemeralEntryID structure] encodes the server that issued the Ephemeral Entry ID and enough information for a client to make a decision as to how to display the object to an end user.
[In EphemeralEntryID] A server MUST NOT change an object's Ephemeral Entry ID during the lifetime of an NSPI session.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1994.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In EphemeralEntryID] A server MUST NOT change an object's Ephemeral Entry ID during two calls.
[In EphemeralEntryID] ID Type (1 byte): The type of this ID.
[In EphemeralEntryID] [IDType] The value is the constant 0x87.
[In EphemeralEntryID] [ID Type] The server uses the presence of this value to identify this EntryID as an Ephemeral Entry ID rather than a Permanent Entry ID.
[In EphemeralEntryID] R1 (1 byte): [means this field is] Reserved.
[In EphemeralEntryID] [R1] All clients and servers MUST set this value to the constant 0x00.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1713.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In EphemeralEntryID] Server MUST set this value [R1] to the constant 0x00.
[In EphemeralEntryID] R2 (1 byte): [means this field is] Reserved.
[In EphemeralEntryID] [R2] All clients and servers MUST set this value to the constant 0x00.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1714.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In EphemeralEntryID] Server MUST set this value [R2] to the constant 0x00.
[In EphemeralEntryID] R3 (1 byte): [means this field is] Reserved.
[In EphemeralEntryID] [R3] All clients and servers MUST set this value to the constant 0x00.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1715.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In EphemeralEntryID] Server MUST set this value [R3] to the constant 0x00.
[In EphemeralEntryID] ProviderUID (16 bytes): A FlatUID_r value, as specified in section 2.2.2.1, that contains the GUID of the server that issued this Ephemeral Entry ID.
[In EphemeralEntryID] R4 (4 bytes): [means this field is] Reserved.
[In EphemeralEntryID] [R4] All clients and servers MUST set this value to the constant 0x00000001.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1716.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In EphemeralEntryID] Server MUST set this value [R4] to the constant 0x00000001.
[In EphemeralEntryID] Display Type (4 bytes): The display type of the object specified by this Ephemeral Entry ID.
[In EphemeralEntryID] [Display Type] This value is expressed in little-endian format.
[In EphemeralEntryID] [Display Type] Valid values for this field are specified in section 2.2.3.

[In EphemeralEntryID] [Display Type] The display type is not considered part of the object's identity; it [display type] is set in the EphemeralEntryID structure by the server as a convenience to clients.
[In EphemeralEntryID] [Display Type] The server MUST set this field when this data structure is returned in an output parameter.
[In EphemeralEntryID] [Display Type] A server MUST ignore values of this field on input parameters.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1665.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In EphemeralEntryID] If this field [Display Type] is set to different values, the server will return the same value.
[In EphemeralEntryID] MId (4 bytes): The Minimal Entry ID of this object, as specified in section 2.2.9.1
[In EphemeralEntryID] [MId] This value is expressed in little-endian format.
[In PermanentEntryID] The PermanentEntryID structure identifies a specific object in the address book.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R609.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PermanentEntryID] Additionally, it [PermanentEntryID structure] encodes the constant Exchange Server NSPI Protocol interface (via the ProviderUID field) and enough information for a client to make a decision as to how to display the object to an end user.
[In PermanentEntryID] Permanent Entry IDs are transmitted in the protocol as values with the PtypBinary property type.
[In PermanentEntryID] A server MAY allow an object's distinguished name (DN) to change.

[In PermanentEntryID] If this [A server allows an object's distinguished name (DN) to change] happens, the server is expected to map a Permanent Entry ID that contains the original DN to the object with the new DN.
[In PermanentEntryID] When returning a PermanentEntryID structure to satisfy a query from a client, a server MUST use the most current version of an object's DN.
[In PermanentEntryID] ID Type (1 byte): The type of this ID.
[In PermanentEntryID] [ID Type] The value is the constant 0x00.
[In PermanentEntryID] [ID Type] The server uses the presence of this value to identify this EntryID as a Permanent Entry ID rather than an Ephemeral Entry ID.
[In PermanentEntryID] R1 (1 byte): [means that this field is] Reserved.
[In PermanentEntryID] [R1] All clients and servers MUST set this value to the constant 0x00.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1717.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PermanentEntryID] Server MUST set this value [R1] to the constant 0x00.
[In PermanentEntryID] R2 (1 byte): [means that this field is] Reserved.
[In PermanentEntryID] [R2] All clients and servers MUST set this value to the constant 0x00.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1718.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PermanentEntryID] [R2] All servers MUST set this value to the constant 0x00.
[In PermanentEntryID] R3 (1 byte): [means that this field is] Reserved.
[In PermanentEntryID] [R3] All clients and servers MUST set this value to the constant 0x00.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1719.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PermanentEntryID] Server MUST set this value [R3] to the constant 0x00.
[In PermanentEntryID] ProviderUID (16 bytes): A FlatUID_r value that contains the constant GUID specified in Permanent Entry ID GUID, as specified in section 2.2.1.7.
[In PermanentEntryID] R4 (4 bytes): [means that this field is] Reserved.
[In PermanentEntryID] [R4] All clients and servers MUST set this value to the constant 0x00000001.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1720.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PermanentEntryID] Server MUST set this value [R4] to the constant 0x00000001.
[In PermanentEntryID] Display Type String (4 bytes): The display type of the object specified by this Permanent Entry ID.
[In PermanentEntryID] [Display Type String] This value is expressed in little-endian format.
[In PermanentEntryID] [Display Type String] Valid values for this field are specified in section 2.2.1.3.
[In PermanentEntryID] [Display Type String] The display type is not considered part of the object's identity; it is set in the PermanentEntryID field by the server as a convenience to clients.
[In PermanentEntryID] [Display Type String] A server MUST set this field when this data structure is returned in an output parameter.
[In PermanentEntryID] [Display Type String] A server MUST ignore values of this field on input parameters.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1666.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In PermanentEntryID] If this field [Display Type String] is set to different values, the server will return the same result.
[In PermanentEntryID] Distinguished Name (variable): The DN of the object specified by this Permanent Entry ID.
[In PermanentEntryID] [Distinguished Name] The value is expressed as a DN, as specified in [MS-OXOABK] section 2.2.1.1.<2>
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R2003004.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In NSPI_HANDLE] The NSPI_HANDLE handle is an RPC context handle that is used to share a session between method calls.
[In NSPI_HANDLE] The RPC context handle is specified in [C706] section 2.3.1.
[In NSPI_HANDLE] This type [NSPI_HANDLE] is declared as follows: typedef [context_handle] void* NSPI_HANDLE;
[In Protocol Details] The client side of this protocol is simply a pass-through.
[In Protocol Details] That is, no additional timers or other state is required on the client side of this protocol.

[In Protocol Details] Calls made by the higher-layer protocol or application are passed directly to the transport, and the results returned by the transport are passed directly back to the higher-layer protocol or application.
[In Protocol Details] The client MUST call the NSPI NspiBind method, as specified in section 3.1.4.1.1, in order to obtain an RPC context handle to be used in all other NSPI methods.
[In Protocol Details] The NSPI NspiUnbind method, as specified in section 3.1.4.1.2, destroys this context handle.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R701.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Protocol Details] Therefore, it is not possible to call any methods other than NspiBind immediately after a call to NspiUnbind.
[In Protocol Details] The final method a client MUST call is NspiUnbind.
[In Server Details] This protocol enables address book access to a directory data store.

[In Server Details]This [This protocol enables address book access to a directory data store] includes address book hierarchy table discovery, address creation template table discovery, address book container access and browsing, and read and modification of individual address book entries.
[In Server Details] In addition to the abstract data model specified here, this specification uses the address book data model, as specified in [MS-OXOABK], for the server of this protocol.
[In Server Details] This specification uses the definitions of object properties specified in [MS-OXPROPS].
[In Timers] This protocol does not introduce any timers.
[In Timers] For details about any transport-level timers, see [MS-RPCE].
[In Initialization] Each server MUST have at least one unique GUID, used to identify an NSPI session, as specified in section 3.1.4.1.1.
[In Initialization] The server MUST acquire this GUID [the GUID used to identify an NSPI session] before it [server] is prepared to respond to Exchange Server NSPI Protocol methods.
[In Initialization] The protocol does not constrain how a server acquires this GUID [the GUID used to identify an NSPI session].
[In Initialization] The server MUST maintain this GUID [the GUID used to identify an NSPI session] for the duration of an NSPI session.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Partially verified by derived requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1993.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Initialization] The server maintains the GUID used to identify an NSPI session during one call.

[In Initialization] Although the protocol places no further boundary or requirements on the time period for which the server maintains this GUID [the GUID used to identify an NSPI session], it is recommended that implementations maximize this time period to improve the usability of the server for clients.
[In Initialization] Each server maintains a set of Address Book objects and containers, as specified in [MS-OXOABK].

[In Initialization] The Exchange Server NSPI Protocol does not constrain how a server obtains its initial data set, nor does it [the Exchange Server NSPI Protocol] constrain the contents of this initial data set [a set of Address Book objects and containers maintained by server].
[In Initialization] How a server obtains this data [initial data set] is an implementation-specific detail.
[In Initialization] When a server is prepared to respond to Exchange Server NSPI Protocol methods, it [server] creates an RPC listening endpoint, as specified in section 2.1.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R4.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] This protocol MUST indicate to the RPC runtime that it is to perform a strict Network Data Representation (NDR) data consistency check at target level 6.0, as specified in [MS-RPCE].

[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] This protocol MUST indicate to the RPC runtime via the strict_context_handle property that it is to reject use of context handles created by a method of a different RPC interface than this one, as specified in [MS-RPCE].

[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] This protocol MUST indicate to the RPC runtime via the type_strict_context_handle property that it is to reject use of context handles created by a method that creates a different type of context handle, as specified in [MS-RPCE].

[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] This interface [MS-OXNSPI] includes the methods listed in the following table [NspiBind, NspiUnbind, NspiUpdateStat, NspiQueryRows, NspiSeekEntries, NspiGetMatches, NspiResortRestriction, NspiDNToMId, NspiGetPropList, NspiGetProps, NspiCompareMIds, NspiModProps, NspiGetTemplateInfo, NspiModLinkAtt, NspiQueryColumns, NspiResolveNames and NspiResolveNamesW].
[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Operation NspiBind: Initiates a session with the server.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R668.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Operation NspiUnbind: Concludes a session with the server.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R701.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Operation NspiUpdateStat: Updates the logical position in a specified table.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R768.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Operation NspiQueryRows: Returns information about a set of rows in a table.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R916.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Operation NspiSeekEntries: Seeks forward in a specified table and update the logical position in that table.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R998.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Operation NspiGetMatches: Restricts a specific table based on input parameters and return the resultant Explicit Table.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1077.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Operation NspiResortRestriction: Changes the sort order of an Explicit Table.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1168.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Operation NspiDNToMId: Translates a DN (1) to a Minimal Entry ID.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1243.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Operation NspiGetPropList: Returns a list of all the properties which exist on a specific object in the address book.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R828.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Operation NspiGetProps: Returns a list of properties and their values for a specific object in the address book.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R859.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Operation NspiCompareMIds: Compares the position of two rows in a table.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1210.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Operation NspiModProps: Modifies a property of a row in the address book.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirement: MS-OXNSPI_R1267.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Operation NspiGetSpecialTable: Retrieves the address book hierarchy table of the server, or retrieves the address creation table from the server.
ns1:Requirement.ns1:VerificationComment: Verified by requirements: MS-OXNSPI_R743, MS-OXNSPI_R752.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Operation NspiGetTemplateInfo: Retrieves addressing or display templates from the server.

[In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] The server MUST return the value OutOfResources if unable to complete processing a method due to lack of some non-memory resource.

ns1:Requirement.ns1:Description: [In Message Processing Events and Sequencing Rules] Note Gaps in the opnum numbering sequence represent opnums that are reserved for local use.
